entry.def: If you say that someone filches something, you mean they steal it, especially when you do not consider this to be a very serious crime.

example.ex: I filched some notes from his wallet.
example.tran: 我从他的钱包里偷了几张钞票。

means.word_mean: 1. make off with belongings of others

auth_sentence.content: If Curley didn't have the money he would filch it from his mother's purse.
auth_sentence.res_content: If Curley didn't have the money he would filch it from his mother's purse.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: If Curley didn't have the money he would filch it from his mother's purse.

means.word_mean: <非正>偷(尤指小的或不贵重的物品)

sentences.en: Jack filched a pen from his friend’s pocket.
sentences.cn: 杰克从朋友的口袋里偷走了一支钢笔。

sentences.en: He filched a piece of chalk from the teacher’s desk.
sentences.cn: 他从老师的书桌上偷取一支粉笔。

sentences.en: Oliver filched a packet of cigarettes from a well-dressed passenger.
sentences.cn: 奥立佛从一名衣冠楚楚的乘客身上偷得一包香烟。
